qas.question: According to Nontrinitarian belief, what is Mary's relationship to Jesus?
Which Nontrinitarian theologian says that God cannot approach eveil spirits to redeem them?
Unittarians, Christadelphians and Jehovah's Witnesses are examples of what kind of church?
"Mother of God" is an example of what kind of title?
Why type of churches did Emanuel Swedenborg visit?
Who did Mary recognize herself as?
Which Nontrinitarian churches once acknowledged Mary as "Mother of God"?
Whom did Mary give access to the evil heredity of the human race?

context: <a2_0>Nontrinitarians<a2_0/>, such as <b6_0>Unitarians, Christadelphians and Jehovah's Witnesses<b6_0/> also acknowledge Mary as the <a0_0>biological mother<a0_0/> of Jesus Christ, but do not recognise <a3_0>Marian<a3_0/> titles such as "<b5_0>Mother of God<b5_0/>" as these groups generally reject Christ's divinity. Since <b4_0>Nontrinitarian churches<b4_0/> are typically also mortalist, the issue of praying to Mary, whom they would consider "asleep", awaiting resurrection, does not arise. <a1_0>Emanuel Swedenborg<a1_0/> says God as he is in himself could not directly approach evil spirits to redeem those spirits without destroying them (Exodus 33:20, John 1:18), so God impregnated Mary, who gave <b7_0>Jesus Christ<b7_0/> access to the evil heredity of the human race, which he could approach, redeem and save.
